ygData.subject: Re: Twinking = Diablo = UO
ygData.msgSnippet: Well who is really to say what is considered twinking . . .  I think we should just play the game and let people do whatever.    I would rather discuss spells
ygData.messageBody:
Well who is really to say what is considered twinking . . . I think we
should just play the game and let people do whatever. I would rather
discuss spells and stuff in this list than people getting mad cus JOE FRIDAY
has full plate or whatever. I don't really like twinking but it happens and
to BAN it seems weird kinda strict. There are too many scenerios. I mean
there is this friend of mine in real life and he plays more than I do and is
higher lvl and he gave me a cool Savant Cap and I like it. So should I be
banned? Dunno, but I'd rather talk about cool "in-game" stuff . . .



----- Original Message -----
From: Elkantar The Wizard <the_elkantar@...>
To: <eq_wizards@onelist.com>
Sent: Monday, May 24, 1999 11:08 AM
Subject: Re: [eq_wizards] Twinking = Diablo = UO


> From: "Elkantar The Wizard" <the_elkantar@...>
>
> I hear a lot of players say that it is wrong and I agree. I hear few say
> leave it alone! I and a lot of other players left twinking alone in UO and
> look where that game is now. Same for Diablo. It does effect me and my
> character cause it will lead to every other player having to twinkle just
to
> play on even ground. Then all the honest players will be left behind like
> UO.
>
> Twinking the Definition....Giving high level gear to a low level
character.
>
> I agree that "low level" is not lower level. I a 10th level wizard gave
> items to a fighter who is 7th level. Things I can not use but he can and
it
> helps our party. He being only 3 levels under me. This just makes sense.
But
> when a 20th level character gives items high in value to a less then 10th
> level character that is simply foolish and exploitable.
>
> Now at 5th level I did find a mighty magical item that someone had
> mistakenly dropped. I belive this is fair in the game. But to have a
> character outfitted by other, in a guild or no, is simply cheating and
will
> ruin the balance of the game.
>
> Elkantar Keeper of the Tome of Magi Lore
>
>
